articles.author: David Lawder, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's new 25% tariffs on imports from Mexico and Canada took effect on Tuesday, along with a doubling of duties on Chinese goods to 20%, launching new trade conflicts with the top three U.S. trading partners.
articles.title: Trade wars erupt as Trump hits Canada, Mexico, China with steep tariffs

articles.author: Bo Erickson, Steve Holland, Joseph Ax
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's speech to Congress on Tuesday was interrupted within minutes by catcalls from Democratic lawmakers, with one Texas congressman, Al Green, ordered removed from the chamber after he refused to sit down.
articles.title: Democrats disrupt Trump’s Congress speech as Texas lawmaker ejected

articles.author: Erin Banco, Gram Slattery, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: Trump has told his advisers that he wants to announce the agreement in his address to Congress tonight, sources say, cautioning that the deal had yet to be signed and the situation could change.
articles.title: Exclusive: US and Ukraine prepare to sign minerals deal on Tuesday, sources say

articles.author: Kevin Yao
articles.description: China's parliament begins its annual session on Wednesday with officials under pressure to tilt their fiscal resources towards consumers to make the economy more resilient in the face of rising U.S. trade tariffs and deflationary pressures.
articles.title: China's parliament meets to shield economy from US tariff salvos

articles.author: Andrew Mills, Yomna Ehab, Nafisa Eltahir
articles.description: Arab leaders adopted an Egyptian reconstruction plan for Gaza on Tuesday that would cost $53 billion and avoid resettling Palestinians, in contrast to U.S. President Donald Trump's Middle East Riviera vision, according to a copy of the plan.
articles.title: Arab states adopt Egyptian alternative to Trump's 'Gaza Riviera'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canada is imposing 25% tariffs on C$30 billion worth of U.S. imports effective immediately, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau told reporters on Tuesday.
articles.title: Canada imposing 25% tariffs on $30 bln of US imports, Trudeau says

articles.author: Andreas Rinke, Riham Alkousaa, Sarah Marsh
articles.description: Germany's conservatives and Social Democrats announced proposals on Tuesday to set up a 500 billion euro fund for infrastructure and overhaul borrowing rules in order to massively up defence spending.
articles.title: German parties agree debt reform, 500 billion euro infrastructure fund

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China will "actively" respond to population aging with policies for its rapidly growing elderly and its young people, including providing childcare subsidies and making preschool education free, as it tries to boost the country's declining population.
articles.title: China to adopt policies for aging population, try to boost birth rates

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British defence minister John Healey will meet U.S. Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth in Washington on Thursday to discuss a peace plan for Ukraine, Britain's ministry of defence said.
articles.title: UK defence minister to meet US counterpart Hegseth on Ukraine peace plan

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump has paused all military aid to Ukraine following his clash with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy last week, a White House official said on Monday.
articles.title: Trump halts all U.S. military aid to Ukraine, White House official says
